Reviews.Title: “Clean pleasant budget hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JAMandS
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for the second time. Yes the rooms are small - this is London and space is at a premium. The corridors are narrow and wind up and down stairs, it is a quirky place. However, the beds are comfortable, it is clean, the staff are pleasant and helpful. It is close to Bayswater and Queensway Tubes and Kensington Palace Gardens. It is as good value for money as you get in London on a budget and would happily go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at budget prices”
Reviews.Author: traveler_raph
Reviews.Content: Small budget hotel, with low price but a friendly staff and decent breakfast, just one block from the Bayswater tube station. Ideal for a familly week-end in London, or a shopping trip on your own. The rooms are small, clean, and overlook a very calm street. The neighborhood is nice and rather residential, but some decent restaurants for an evening meal are available on the main street, on both sides of the tube station.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer201
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice in the last few years, it is usually decently priced, is in a fantastic location just a block or two from two major tube stations for 2 of the main lines, right by hyde park, portebello/notting hill, kensington palace. You can easily walk to most of the major tourist sights. The staff is typically friendly and helpful, on our last stay we did get placed into this one room that was laughably tiny on the first floor, I thnk it was 117 or something like that? but it was so small to open the door and let my mum get past me I had to stand on the bed, to be honest though we thought it was really funny and would have kept the room if the shower hadn't of been too small for my mum to keep using, but when we explained that and told them which room it was they were really good about switching the room for us. Also a note that when the elevator broke down on one of our stays when we were leaving one of their staff carried my very large heavy suitcase down a billion sets of stairs for me, whcih I thought was excellent service. Our favorite thing about this hotel though is that it's very typically faulty towers esque, very British feeling with its disjointed and winding starcases and floors. All in all, we quite like it and would happily come back for our next visit. The rooms are nothing fancy, but the beds are comfy, the location could not be more perfect, the staff is good and the prices are fair.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsznjo
Reviews.Content: 7th time here. Its easy placed for 2 tube lines and on a quiet street. Yes the rooms are a little small but we always book classic double and the beds are very comfortable. We stay here because its value and easy to get to and from. Its a good quality budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Three Great Things About This Hotel: Location, Location and Location !”
Reviews.Author: ajay04_10
Reviews.Content: The Berjaya scores a perfect ten for its truly outstanding location and on this count alone should be a first choice for budget conscious travellers. The Queensway and Bayswater stations are really close... and a whole streetful of restaurants, fast food, pub, mall, shops and souvenir stores, merely steps from the front door. Truly the epitome of convenience. Other than that, the room was so tiny that we were side stepping and tip toeing our way around. The toilet was equally minuscule. The wash basin was exactly the length of my toothbrush (yes, I measured) so you can imagine. But then you are in the best part of London, kind of, so with the money you pay, it is still a good deal. I recall with fondness Ali at the front desk, as also Marco, who were so helpful during our stay. Despite everything, I would probably stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Top Pick for convenient location & basic amenities”
Reviews.Author: jayen77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days based on recommendations from a few friends. Upon arrival & after check-in, the first thing I noticed was the small elevator. Seriously, it is very, very small. You'll be lucky to fit 1 person with 1 big luggage. 2 persons is practically impossible. Secondly, the rooms are very simple, very basic. They are, essentially, a spacious closet. The only redeeming quality for the hotel if you are looking for plenty of halal food, & closest to the Bayswater station (it is really, really close, just behind the hotel about 25 steps away) & quick 5 mins ride to Oxford St, Bond St, Marble Arch, etc. with 2 supermarkets, a town car service nearby, a convenience store, & a small shopping mall, it is supremely worth it. I would pick this hotel just for the location & the convenient access to basic amenities nearby. The hotel is good enough to lay your bed for the night. :)

Reviews.Title: “Slecht in veel opzichten. Zelfs na de klacht bij het hoofdkantoor te hebben gedeponeerd geen reactie.”
Reviews.Author: viaDordt
Reviews.Content: I did stay (2 pax) at Berjaya in London but am absolute disapppointed about the service this London hotel provides: when not being claustofobic you will get it in the elevator and upstairs; room was not clean, we stayed at 307 after a chance from the top floor where it was stinking and an empty bottle under the bed and a left-over from shopping clothes; not even a hook or two for wet clothes in the room behind doors or on the wall; food was very bad and not fresh, so we sended it back twice. Even our tomato salad was taken away without finishing it. The waiter said not to have any complains, ofcourse.. the restaurant was empty; - the bed moves away from the wall because it has rollers; - room upstairs: you hear them walk; ;the bath tube is leaking from the bottom so it swims into the bathroom; ;the summun is to ask a depot for every bag to deposit in the hotel for a few hours after checking out before you get them again to catch the plane; the receptionist could NOT telephone/order a black cab for us! He told us he would telephone another they work with!! My goodness, this was a family car (no taxi!) who did not even know where our location was to take us (OXO), no knowledge!! And he did not have any change of just two pounds, he would leave it in an enveloppe at the receptiondesk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel very close to underground stations. Expensive Internet access.”
Reviews.Author: Arvid R
Reviews.Content: Small and pretty out dated rooms, but ok. The beds were comfortable enough. Extremely narrow bathroom. The reception area was much more aesthetically pleasing than the rest of the hotel. Good value for money. (Ordered through hotels.com). The underground stations Bayswater and Queensway are in the neighbourhood, which is great. No internet, unless you buy a voucher in the reception. This was expensive (approx 6 UK pounds for 60 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Fine for price but dont expect luxury”
Reviews.Author: kiki_725
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and the lobby was very smart looking. The hotel is not too far from central London and is only a short walk from shoreditch market. My room was very cold on entry and the curtains hung in front of the radiator meaning they blocked most of the heat. The bathroom was FREEZING, there was no heating so i had to leave the bathroom door open to allow the heat from the room to warm it. The bed was comfy and i would have had a great nights sleep if it wasnt for the people coming back late and waking me, the people above my room stamping and waking me and the two doors near my room banging when people when through them!! The bathroom was very small (so small the loo handle had been fitted backwards so rather than projecting out to the right it projected out to the left - otherwise it would have hit the wall) The shower was again tiny and the water pressure very poor. For one night the room was fine but i wouldn't recommend it for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest bathroom ever...”
Reviews.Author: Paul R
Reviews.Content: The one thing that will stick in my mind of this place is the bathroom, which was in my single room, basically a cupboard with toilet at one side of the door, sink in the middle, and shower at the other side. It was basically impossible for anybody over 5'2" to sit on the toilet without wrapping their knees around the u-bend of the sink. The single beds are quite narrow, even for singles, and the decor was a little tired, and the room felt claustrophobic even for West London standards (I've stayed in about half a dozen hotels in the local area). It's not the worst place I've stayed, but I can think of other places within short walking distance that have given me more for my money at a comparable budget. Add into the mix it seems to be two buildings connected into one, with very poor signage (and therefore finding the room when tired can be a bit of a challenge), and it adds up to a below-average experience, but I'll give them an average rating for effort and having a bar that is half-reasonable and quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: AnKat-69
Reviews.Content: We readed reviews before our trip and didnt expect too much. Yes, room and bathroom are tiny, but it wasnt problem for us. Room was clean enought. Only real problem was that water pressure in shower was low, it was enough to have a shower, but washing the long hair was quite a challenge. Anyway, the location is excellent and the staff was friendly. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Will never return!”
Reviews.Author: 1879fulham
Reviews.Content: I stay in many hotels in London on business and would return to many but I will never stay here again. The staff are surly and pretty unhelpful (apart from the guy who took me to my room) which was room 64 that from reception was down a corridor down some stairs into a lift upto one level and then down a further corridor (very strange layout) . The room was compact but adequate although the bathroom was a joke with a very tight shower. Biggest let down was that this hotel which is supposedly 3star charge £15 a day YES £15 a day for wifi. This is the most expensive charge I have ever incurred for obtaining wifi so pretty much sums this hotel up namely it is greedy, expensive and looks to rip off it's customers. I will never return here again. Also if breakfast is not included in your deal expect to pay £8.95 for your continental breakfast that comprises of processed ham and cheese, some bread and some cereal selection whoopee! Alternatively go outside and walk 20 or so yards and get yourself something a little bit more enterprising and exciting. Better options are elsewhere full stop!

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Rooms But Excellent Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: khong_sharon
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms in the hotel are in a dire need of a major revamp and its maze-like set-up can be confusing. Having read its negative reviews, I went with an open mind and am pleased to say that I found the beds comfy and room reasonably clean. What I like best is its location - quite self-sufficient in that you don't have to walk far for food and shopping with Tesco Metro, Tesco Express, Sainsbury, Whiteley Shopping Centre, Boots, Superdrug, McD, Burger King, Subway, the famous Four Season, Italian restaurants, etc that line the streets together with souvenir shops and pubs, and served by 2 different tube lines, the Circle and Central lines. In fact, after visiting the must-sees in the city, I had most of my dinners at the restaurants in the vicinity. Restaurants worthy of mention are of course, the Four Season and the cosy Ristorante Italiano next to Subway (if not mistaken, there are at least 3 Italian restaurants in that locality) and the Cafe Roma which served good breakfast. Last but not least, the hotel's saving grace must be its staff members. They are top-notch - providing good and courteous service. Unlike the posher hotel that I stayed in Paris - the staff here had no hesitation at all to lug my suitcases up 2 floors to my room, all done with a smile. Will I return to this hotel on my next trip to London - why not?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireNewbery
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Berjaya in November, and couldn't fault our stay. Location of the hotel is perfect - just around the corner from Bayswater station, and close to plenty of shops and restaurants. We visited London for a show and sightseeing so didn't spend too much time at the hotel. Our room was the Double Deluxe Room which was lovely and very well decorated, with everything we needed. We stayed on the ground floor which may be a little noisy for some in the morning but it wasn't a problem. If you are planning on staying at the hotel, I would advise you to book the Deluxe room as it does seem a lot nicer than the regular rooms for not a lot more money. Staff were very helpful - We arrived at the hotel to check-in three hours early and as our room was ready, we were able to check-in straight away which was great. On checking-out, we were due to leave at 12midday but as we were running late, we telephoned the hotel to see if we could check-out two hours later and it was not a problem. (Though this may not be possible during more busy periods) We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, so we had breakfast at a little Italian cafe next door for just a fraction of the price. Lovely little bar/restaurant with open fire at the hotel too. Got a really good price for our room. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My worst stay in London”
Reviews.Author: tippiella
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights last year, and it was the worst hotel stay I've had in London. We were four people traveling together and my mother and I shared a twin room. It was tiny (although I expect no more of a budget hotel in London) and filthy. The window was drafty and the room was freezing. When we complained about it the people at reception said the janitor had left for the day and they couldn't do anything about the heating until the next day. When we asked again the next day they told us the heating system was broken and that there was nothing they could do. We slept in our clothes for four nights - although the London weather was warmer than expected we were both glad to have brought wool socks and hats. The bathroom was also run-down and filthy, and no larger than a cupboard. My mother is about 5 feet tall and very petite and she had trouble turning around in the shower. I didn't use our shower once, but rather borrowed the one in our friends' room a couple of times. If you had asked them they would probably have given a very different review of this hotel, as their room was nicely renovated with a lovely white sparkling clean bathroom, and while we were catching colds in our room they slept with the windows open and were quite comfortable. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that the lobby area and the bar is quite nice and the location is excellent, and if you are lucky and get one of the renovated rooms you will probably be comfortable enough. For me it was a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect anything special”
Reviews.Author: alx1234
Reviews.Content: I had booked a twin room for myself and my daughter for one night. First of all, the room is SO small we cannot put our luggage (1 medium size suitcase each) anywhere. We had to put one on the small table next to the TV and one on the floor against the door (blocking the door). The room temperature was at least 26 C, no way to turn the heater down. We ended up sleeping with the window wide open. The noise was quite disturbing, from both the rooms next to us and from outside. The bedroom was SO small and VERY old. I would not recommend anyone to stay there, not for 110£ a night.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: Jeanius1
Reviews.Content: I had a single room, just below ground level. The room was small, but had everything you needed. I found the room fine. However, I could hear every single whisper on the corridor, and I was awoken at 6.30am the next morning (Sunday) by pounding footsteps so loud the light fixture shook. It was absolutely impossible to get any sleep. I assume I was below the restaurant kitchen, and there was no attempt to sound insulate. When I was leaving, I mentioned to the receptionist that the room should be offered at a cheaper rate, as it was the absolute worst night sleep I had ever had, due to the noise. He just looked confused, and said no one had said anything before. The room was absolutely terrible, and I do not believe that no one had ever complained about it before.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Lovely2709
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my Fiance, wanted somewhere central for a hectic 2 day trip! We are frequent visitors to London and often find it hard to get value, cleanliness & location. Stayed on this street previously in a different hotel and really liked it. Other reviews worried us but we gave it a go and are delighted we did! A 2 minute walk from Bayswater tube station and about 5 mins to Queensway. Very friendly welcome from the lady on reception. Corridors are quite small and pokey and possibly in need of a refurb, although it is an older building. We booked a deluxe double, on advice from another review. It was the biggest room I've ever stayed in in London with a large spacious bathroom & big shower. Absolutly spotless too with all the usual amenities. We were very pleasantly surprised and would definitely stay here again. I would certainly book a deluxe double though as I think the other rooms could do with a facelift!

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: TrondM
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 20 people from Norway who went to London to watch some fotball (soccer). We did not really expect a lot as it was not that expensive to be in the middle of London, a few 100 meters from Hyde Park.. At the arrival we were told that they hotel did not have enough twin-bed rooms for all, so that some had to share a double bed. As you may imagine, that was not accepted, so they had to give some of us single-bed rooms instead. I had paid for a single-bed room, and as I paid the same as two guys paid for a twin-bed room I expected a room at the same size. However the single-bed rooms are very very small. But as this was a trip where we spent most of our time at the pubs and watching fotball at the Spurs, it was not really a problem. I do feel rather ripped off though. The bed was a two part bed with no top-matress so you can feel the contents of the bed trough the sheets. Not a problem for me, but not good for people who have a bad back. The elevator can only handle two people, and the hotel is a complete maze. But it is an old bulding so tha had to be expeted. The first night I only slept for a few hours before going out again. We did not have breakfast included so we did not eat there. The last night we spent some hours at the bar.. Seems they had a cooperation with a prostitute there who came chatting with us. We tried to ignore her, but she was persistant and the barkeeper did nothing about it. It ended with us leaving the bar (without her). Internet cost 15£ pr 24 hours. Decent speed, but they hotel should probably look to most of the other hotels in the world and understand that internet is supposed to be free these days. Despite having a room at the 3rd floor, it was incredibly hot inside. Even with the window up and the oven turned off.. This was the last weekend of october, so it should be colder than that. I am told by my friends that the basement rooms were even warmer and the view there was BS. I will probably push for a bit more comfy hotel the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very well based but poorly managed hotel”
Reviews.Author: dereklangton
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Berjaya to my prebooked double room and found it to be in the shape and dimensions of a mouse trap. They changed my room. In the new room the shower water temperature was unstable, and the niagara (flush water of the toilet) was unable to remove residual feces - the stream was too weak. I asked the plumber, who came over and apparently fixed both problems - only to reappear in no time. I asked him again, he came again (I was covering my nudity with a towel), and again it was no use. I gave up and did my best to manage keeping my grievances to myself. I fought with the niagara by pouring hot water into it, i.e. was cooking my dungs, with the inevitably resulting smell. Later on, I was expecting a visitor who came to be interviewed for a job. The girl in the reception told him I had checked out. When he insisted on being connected to my room, she told him the line was occupied. Later, when I inquired into these peculiarities she narrated, with ever-increasing enthusiasm that a guest whose first name was identical with mine had really left (the poor chick was not taught to check for the surname as well) and the line, well the line, ah, she asked the technician to see what was wrong about it. This gentleman, invited to be interviewed, kept waiting patiently in the lobby (he needed the job) and I was waiting for him impatiently in my room for a long whole hour! When we did meet at last, I felt ashamed for having humiliated him. In my desperation I yelled at her, which only helped to encourage her to add fresh excuses for her unbelievable inability. None of the many employees staring amazed at the appalling scene bothered to intervene or assume professional leadership. They charged me for leaving my luggage with the hotel after having checked out! I could add more regrettable examples of this repulsive phenomenon, but I'd rather not. In conclusion - this hotel employes too many workers, but no responsible adult MANAGER with authority and initiative. Most of the employees are mere frightened third-world work-immigrants, with minimal (if any) English, no preparation at all for their jobs, and evidently too poorly paid. Keep away from this hut imported from the banks of the Ganges river!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Vaughanio
Reviews.Content: I feel this hotel is in an excellent location and isnt bad for the price. Looks great from the outside but the rooms are pretty small inside. My biggest gripe was the fact hardly any of the plug sockets worked and the stingy tea/coffee portions in the room.

Reviews.Title: “do not go near this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharon b
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel me or my 4 colleagues have ever stayed in. My room was tiny had three single beds and a pillar in the middle of the room and looked out onto a fire escape covered in broken glass. I asked to move - the next option was marginally better but pokey, grubby and had terrible stains on the walls and ceilings. My friends room had a broken loo seat and a cracked sink. Breakfast was very mediocre although plenty of choice. Please please please do not stay in this hotel - London has so much more to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Looks can deceive!!”
Reviews.Author: trickster8
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Berjaya eden park on Friday 9th Sept to attended the Proms in the park. Having stayed in Inverness Terrace before and been very disappointed we (me, my partner and a female friend) were quite impressed by the "plush" reception. While I watched the car outside to guard from stalking traffic wardens (beware!! you have been warned!!!) My partner took her case to our room while our friend took her case to her single room (101 yes ROOM 101!) On meeting the girls back in reception , both with glum faces our friend asked me to have a look at her room which I did. Absolutely beyond belief !! The whole area was 3m x 3m. which included a bathroom with bath and shower over, a wc and a basin, a single bed hard against the wall with 300mm gap to gain access, a chair and a single wardrobe. There was a window which looked directly onto a blank wall some 1m away. We complained and got a free breakfast. Our Double room was not much bigger but we did have a large bathroom which enabled us to store our cases (and our friends) etc. to give us a bit more circulation.Breakfast was until 10-30 when spot on 10-30 we were informed that the restaurant was now closed , could we finish and leave. Not a good experience although it is well positioned for Hyde Park

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGetaway4
Reviews.Content: The room is super tiny but the Location is the selling point here. London tube is just 3mins away and food can be found everywhere. Will definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: feibeesi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in Aug'11 and found the hotel to be perfectly adequate. The best thing about the hotel is that it is located within 2 minutes walk to the Bayswater and Queensway tube station. The area is also bustling with plenty of good restaurants including the famous Four Seasons Chinese Restaurant. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: macymae2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a fleeting visit, and I have to say, for the price, it was good. The rooms are small. However, I liked that they were very modern. Nice big glass shower. The best bit was the location. Very easy to get to most places, either by tube, or to walk. (oxford street etc. ) Overall...would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Service by request”
Reviews.Author: marianne h
Reviews.Content: Checked in by name , got a roomkey , was pointed towards the lift , and told to press B... Big problem , since B is for BASEMENT!! Walked in a long , carpented warm and narrow hallway , just to find a tiny room ,facing the back alley and a big fan... Didnt touch the room , went all the way back upstairs to complain , and got nowhere.. The thing is - a friend of us stays there every time she is in London ,and had called them in advanse asking them to give us a nice room... Tryed to remind them-they didnt know what I was talking about ! Got my friend to call them - and they instantly changed their tone... "Oh yes ! we will treat them like royalties"... SO , if not for that , our stay would have been terrible - a nice room is EVERYTHING when on holiday!! We got a nice room and a pleasent stay in the end , but only "by spesial request"

Reviews.Title: “With the good price, we will be back !”
Reviews.Author: silur31
Reviews.Content: We went to London just for the weekend. We found hotel nice, breakfast was good, the price that we have paid was OK - it was a really good deal. We didn't speak to the staff only few words at check in and check out - managed by ourselves to visit London. The district very central - the only one thing that we didn't like it was the window in the room and in the bathroom that we couldn't close at all. If you take a shower in the morning you're freezing ! But overall, nice stay !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for London visitors..!!”
Reviews.Author: nencio89
Reviews.Content: The Deluxe double room was like the description; the camera has Tv Lcd, security box, two armchairs, the bathroom has a big shower, very clean, simple and ordered. The hotel is next to Queensway, a very useful tube station. Hyde park entrance is near 50 m. The neighborhood is quite also if is full of shops and restaurants (and fast food). I advice to all visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms are tired”
Reviews.Author: joanna686
Reviews.Content: We stayed 29th to 31st July. Reception was lovely, bar & dining area also very nice. lift was tiny, my mum has had knee replacements in both knees, so lift was great after long days out walking for 12 hours.Leaving lift was the true view of the hotel. dirty looking, outdated decor, woodchip wallpaper, OH MY GOD!!!!! Room was tiny had to side step around room, bathroom was teeny tiny, I didn't know shower trays came so small about 18" squ, All though tiny the room was dated but ok, we only used it to sleep and shower in.Would stay again, but would pay abit more for a bigger room like those pictured on website.

Reviews.Title: “A great locatiom; that's all”
Reviews.Author: limely
Reviews.Content: stayed for a week. basement room approached thru a maze of corridors. creaky floorboards. paint peeling off the ceiling of the bathroom. elevator out of order for the whole week. charge of one 50 pence to leave luggage at hotel after checkout; don't know if other hotels do the same? continental breakfast cost 9 pounds; you can have breakfast for 6 pounds 1 minute away, at queensway cafes, Bayswater underground station is closed for upgrading. the district and circle lines do not stop there. I read the tripadvisor reports prior to my trip; must say, they are very reliable and unbiased. so if you're looking for a central location, and little else, this hotel is ok.

Reviews.Title: “one night stand”
Reviews.Author: Su333
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and was really pleased with the location 2 tube stations right on the doorstep. We were a little unlucky that our room was at front on a busy corner. But we didn't spend much time in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!”
Reviews.Author: Trulsern73
Reviews.Content: We were five people who traveled to London for a nice week, all good apart from the hotel. Extremely small, dirty room where the shower did not work on one of the rooms. The first night had one of us stay in single rooms as they had not managed to fix beds in the other rooms. Never ever again!

Reviews.Title: “All $ goes to Location”
Reviews.Author: Cymia
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location - between Bayswater and Queensway Room - we booked the Deluxe one so is pretty new and modern Don't expect anything except these. Showering was our nightmare everyday.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel-3178
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at this hotel for one night. We were going to a festival in Hyde Park, the location was fantastic for us easy to get to from Paddington and other stations within walking distance from the festival etc. Upon arrival we were told that our standard room was being complimentary upgraded and was given a lovely modern clean room which was a good size. Breakfast, although continental was nice with a good selection. We would definitely reccommend this hotel and would stay here again. i should state that we booked via a discount travel company and paid a reduced rate to the advertised price via the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “awful would not go back.”
Reviews.Author: dancerboo
Reviews.Content: rooms were very small, needs a lot of refurbishing as the bathroom in the room i stayed in had cracked tiles, the shower was not working, and a very dirty shower tray, the bedspreads were not clean and had burn holes in them, coffee and tea was not replaced each day as required, staff were rude, unfriendly and unhelpful. the windows would not open, the tv did not work. i have had no response to my complaint or E,mails very overpriced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: inele2
Reviews.Content: I was a late arrival around 11pm and was given the key to a room. When I got to the room it was already occupied. They then told me it was fully booked and put me to another hotel. Whilst waiting another couple had also been overbooked and been moved to another hotel. When arriving to another hotel Berjaya had booked the room in another guests name, and more problems arose. Staff were rude and inconsiderate. I picked this hotel due to ideal location for hyde park and ended up quite far and hence having to pay tube fee. I would not recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Three Star Joke”
Reviews.Author: Brazilnuts1
Reviews.Content: On arrival the Berjaya Hotel looked very clean, lovely entrance with your usual London hotel bejew feel. As we were early prior to checkin the staff labeled our bags with what was a piece of sticky tap and a raffle ticket. Mean while the other staff behind the desk were franticly rushing around trying to find my details. One bag was taken and the other left in the foyer so meant we couldnt leave and had to wait a further 5-10min before the same chap came back for the other bag. During which a couple were checking out who at the time seemed very perterved and unhappy about their stay. Only until our return to check in and move into the room an hour later we seemed to have the same issue with the bags. Finally bags arrive and told to go and the the lift to 2nd floor. On the lift opening I can only but describe this as if you held a match box upside down and pushed the middle piece as if opening. I am the largest of persons but neither am I small 3persons if you are lucky will fit in this lift. Again on the lift opening to second floor you then begin to see space is something of an issues with a room door 2steps away and corridors that looked like rabbit worrens. Stairs twists and turns and dead ends everywhere. God forbid a fire emergency evacuation as the exit signs don't seem to help much either. Finally on finding the room on initial inspection seemed quite clean although has to be the smallest I have ever stayed in (nothing as shown on the picture on the website). A twin room beds diagonal to each other but so close the may as well be one and the bases of the beds dirty, stained and ripped in places. Worn carpets, a solid matrice where the floor was probably the more comfortable and again very dark and dingy. On a closer inspection the door to the "bathroom" only opens 3/4 the way as the sink was behind it. The floor, tile grout and silicon seal joints around the bath had mould. A shower head full of lime scale and so on and so on. Back to the rabbit worren on leaving the room the labyrinth of corridors managed to beat our memory something King Henry 8th would have been proud of in his hammersmith gardens. We ended up on a lower ground floor where we bumper into a maid and asked for help to the exit. She replied in broken English "no exit" more than slight worrying but eventually finding our way out 2min later with releaf. We stayed 2 nights "unfortunately" and on the evening returning on the second night the beds hadn't been made from the night before. The only plus side is the location, I wouldn't recommend the Berjaya to anyone unless you are paying 70% or less than the given price per night, however if you are disabled and are thinking of staying get out your barge poles!! On checkout the staff looked at me on complaining about the room as if to ask themselves why is he complaining and didn't say a word in reply just a stand a smile! On leaving after setteling the FULL bill I simply quoted "This place is a 3 Star JOKE".

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: lajty
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in June and the best about it is the location-metro station Bayswater (Green line) is just around the corner and 50m far away from the Hyde Park.As this was my first trip to London I wanted to see as much as I could so I was in my room only to spend a night,otherwise I will have complainments about room size-it is very very small,the bathroom is one the smallest I have ever seen but like I said for just spending night it is fine.The breakfast was fine too,but the choice could be bigger. I would recommend this hotel to all of you who do not expect too much from accommodation but want to be close to main points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great!”
Reviews.Author: KLMOMof2
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel but at the price and location, we don't expect much too. The whole experience was good as there was no hassle checking in. Our room was tiny but then we were hardly in there much. Only complaint will be how the window does not seem to lock properly. No much of an issue as generally we feel safe around the area. There manouvering along the maze-like corridor will be a problem to families with a lot of luggage or small children with their buggies and stuff. We also do not see any offer of help to send the luggage up. Did not see any elevators except for one near our corridor that said 'not working'. thank goodness we were on the first floor!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, dark, embarrassing. And that's just the bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: DanBird
Reviews.Content: We stupidly stayed here twice. Before and after our European tour. As other reviews state, the entry is beautiful and form the outside it looks quaint. When we first arrived they showed us to a room in the basement, it was horrible. I was never going to stay there. We then got moved to a room that smelt like smoke and had mouldy walls. The bathroom was old and worn but at least manageable. We battled through our first 3 days. Breakfast was ok, but the staff kept fighting which was off putting and i ordered a real coffee and it never came. Our 2nd stay was in an even smaller room and bathroom was a joke. I have cupboards at home bigger than that. You couldn't even get changed in there. We stayed in caravans that have a more generous space for washing. Very disappointing. The only saving grace for this hotel is the location, it's super close to a train station and there was a launderette right near by if you need to wash clothes. I would not stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: deanicko
Reviews.Content: I stayed for ten nights at this hotel and it was my second stay. I arrived at 08:30 am and was told my room would not be ready until 2pm. I just got off a 23 hour long haul flight and asked if they could find me something else. They found me another room downstairs which was small but clean. A staff member helped me with my luggage and drew the blinds so I could sleep. I found the staff to be very helpful and courteous. Breakfast was provided and although it was the same selection daily it was fine. Room service was good although I tried to order the chefs special a couple of times and it was unavailable. This hotel is so central to two tube stations and around the corner for the connection for hop on hop off bus tours. Walking distance to Kensington palace. Bayswater has a wide range of shops and eateries which is only a one minute walk. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect luxury but worth staying...”
Reviews.Author: merict
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent 5 nights at Berjaya Eden and we enjoyed every moment as the hotel was just half a minute away from the Underground and all the local food stores. You can't imagine how important this is after a very tiring day. It is almost easier than staying in a luxury hotel with a big entrance and hallways where we would have to walk more. It is a typical big London house with narrow corridors and modest sized bedroom converted to a hotel. If you are planning to use the hotel facilities, there is only bar and restaurant available. If you want to spend time in your room and enjoy the view then you must ask for rooms facing the street as our room 510 was facing to a church next to the hotel but we did not mind at all as we left very early and came late.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, fabulous breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Ariana2011
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny, but it was full of sunlight, perfectly clean and warm. The location is excellent because you have two different underground stations one and a half block away only. Breakfast is fabulous, with anything you can imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad you have to remember this hotel is half price of many others”
Reviews.Author: loutoo
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous after booking this hotel due to the reviews on here...we arrives very well located basically one minute from bayswater tube station, took a while to check in...we thought it odd then we realised all staff were attending to someone who had collapsed and were waiting for an ambulance so of course we completely understood that however when attention was given to us staff were friendly enough. What u must do with this hotel is pay the extra £18 odd it is a night to upgrade to a deluxe room these are newly renovated bathroom modern and clean still small but so much better than the standard rooms nice 3/4 bed nice flat screen tv and decor etc. Our room was in the basement so it is a little noisy with the road outside and early morning when staff start work above you so that was a negative. The important thing to remember when booking this hotel 2 nights here come to just under £200 you won't get that anywhere else. You can't expect to pay cheap and have everything perfect. No one would pay 170£ a night to stay there So they can't charge that. If u are looking for a clean little shabby in parts a little noisy but if like us you are young and fit enough to deal with a little noise and burning your bum on the heated towel rail when you get out the shower (cos it's so small!) it's fine for the money I Would stay again...remember upgrade to a deluxe room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Remember it's a cheap hotel you cant expect 5* treatment”
Reviews.Author: loutoo
Reviews.Content: Considering how cheap this place is half the price of others its ok. Location excellent one minute walk from bayswater tube station and lots of shops. We upgraded to a deluxe room for just over £18 a night more was Defo worth it I knew the standard room was a bit rubbish Cos I had looked on here first. Nice bed and tv nice bathroom but small. We were in the basement so it can be noisy with the road and early morning staff above you moving around , but you know what for the money it's not bad. Carpets a little shabby check in/out a bit slow but if you are away for A couple of days what's the big rush?! our check in was horrible as we had realised someone had collapsed and there was an ambulance on the way staff dealt with it well and if course that is An exceptional circumstance if like us as long as it's clean and not too far out stay here I would again. If you want the Hilton stay at the Hilton

Reviews.Title: “Not what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: OrganOlive
Reviews.Content: As I first arrived to the reception for check-in I was greeted with what was to me the coldest greeting I have ever had in many years of travelling. Then, the rooms. We were travelling with an infant and were offered a room through the maze in the basement, utterly difficult to move around the corridors with a push chair, a year and a half little boy and all the luggage. The size of the room was very small and in a desperate need of refurbishment and modernisation. The bathroom was bad but not as bad as our friends' room, where you could not literally seat on the toilet and close the door for privacy. And the views from our window? A dirty patio full of left over building materials, and we didn't have bars on the window for protection! When we asked to be moved to a different room we were told that the hotel was full, which to us it didn't seem to be the truth. The following day we asked to be moved again and we had the same answer, straight away, without even checking or offering any apologies. All in all, my advice would be to stay away from this hotel unless there are not any more rooms available in London and you don't mind being squeezed over!.

Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: rstoned
Reviews.Content: This is a horrible hotel! The only good thing about it is its location. The rooms are very very small. The bathrooms are much smaller!! The window in our room didn't stayed open.The wallpaper is coming off the walls. They also charge 15 pounds for WiFi a day!! It is a very old hotel and not well maintained. We stayed there for 3 nights this month with friends - we had one double and two single rooms - all of them were horrible! Especially the bathrooms are literally a joke! After our first night I asked reception for another room and they transfered us to a little more spacious room but the bathroom was again very very small and in a very bad condition, there was even a hole in the floor! The most ridiculous thing is this : we had a double room in the third floor and our friend had a single room exactly below us in second floor. When we took a bath in our room, water came out from the ceiling light of our friend's room in the second floor!!!!! Off course she complained about this dangerous situation and they transfered her to an equally horrible room!!! So me and our friends have experienced 5 of this hotel's ''glorious'' rooms and there is only one thing to say: stay away from this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: SouthernerRich
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the rates we could get were reasonable for the area. We wish we had payed double and stayed elsewhere!! Where to start, The rooms are minute and in need of a refurb. The wallpaper is coming off the walls, furniture is starting to break apart and the beds are starting to give too. I won't start on the bathroom! The whole hotel was baking hot even in the night when the outside temp was cool. The hotel is over 5 floors with one lift serving all floors, which is not normally a problem but the lift can only accomodate two people - no luggage! After waiting 10 minutes for the lift to arrive we decided to venture down the stairs through the maze to the reception. I would recommend using the stairs. When going for breakfast, check that they have the right number of people in the room and if you are having a full english make sure you order it when you go into the restaurant. We were shown to our table and after 40 minutes our waiter brought out our breakfast without even asking what we wanted - depsite the menu showing a choice of how you want your eggs cooked!!! They also only brought out one meal as they only showed one person staying in the room. once the breakfast did arrive we only manged to eat the hash brown and bacon as the rest was either cold or looked like last nights left overs. The excuse was the chef was busy as there were 5 people waiting to eat - With a hotel with 5 floors this is appauling. Service in the hotel was very poor - even the reception staff who tried to charge me 3 times for the room. If you stay in a room overlooking the street (Inverness Terrace) you will find that despite seeming relatively quiet it is very noisey nearly all night. If you do decide that you can't find another suitable hotel, eat out! The location is nice to go for a walk round hyde park, we ventured through hyde park towards Oxford Street for some retial therapy which was a lovely walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: AnneMarie63
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to what everyone is saying that's bad I had a great experience when I stayed last month with my boyfriend, the rooms were clean bright staff was very friendly and helpful, the restaurant food was gorg, just overall great exp. Thanks berjaya and I will be returning soon. Megan

Reviews.Title: “perfect, good value and location in central london”
Reviews.Author: Stive187147
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located,in this case, it's so near to Bayswater Tube station ( Underground) less than 1 min walk behind hotel to the station entrance.very nice hotel great location good staff, nice room.

Reviews.Title: “horrible and deceptive”
Reviews.Author: sashayub
Reviews.Content: they dont give the rooms that are there in the photos....the hotel is old and not well maintained...there is also a problem with lifts if you are physically not able to climb stairs...and the washrooms are horrible and old with rust and rot

Reviews.Title: “I stayed at the Berjaya with my daughter last week and will be staying there again during the royal weeding next week.”
Reviews.Author: Josephine46
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Berjaya with my daughter last week and will be staying there again during the royal weeding next week. Both me and my daughter really loved the property and the staff were all so nice and made us feel so welcome. The location was fantastic, you can see Kensington Gardens from the hotel and Bayswater tube-station is right next door. We stayed in a Deluxe room and it was bright and area with a really modern feel to it. They have a loyalty scheme, which we signed up to. So when we stay there next week we get special rates, accrue points towards a free night stay, a welcome snack and drink and I think 25% discount in the bar and restaurant. We tried the restaurant which is also really nice. See you next week. Josx

Reviews.Title: “The pictures on internet are lying”
Reviews.Author: busterOslo
Reviews.Content: The information we found on internet was not correct - it looked very nice on the pictures. We were offered a room in the basement, but were luckily mooved to 3 floor. Our room seemed to be for one person - very small - one chair, one night-cupboard, one cupboard for clothes. Small bathroom - the temperature of the water in the shower was not possible to regulate. They said they wood call for a reparator, but we never saw him. We were dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Location makes everything perfect.”
Reviews.Author: julesgrl215
Reviews.Content: I'm a teenager and I went to London with my mom last April. This hotel was absolutely perfect for us. The location was amazing. It was a minute away from the Bayswater station, and buses ran through the area constantly. It took ten minutes to get from the hotel to central London. Also, all around the hotel were little Tesco shops where you can get some food, plenty of currency exchanges, and many souvenir shops that are much cheaper than the others you'll find. The service was great. We needed to know how to get to a specific train station so that we could go to Windsor Castle, and the people at reception were more than willing to help and explain everything. The rooms were a good size, clean, and comfortable. I don't understand why people are making such a fuss about the bathrooms. Yes the sink was the smallest I've even seen, but we had a tub and a shower, and honestly I wasn't in London to spend time in a hotel room. This was a great stay, and a memorable trip. HIGHLY recommended.

Reviews.Title: “perfect, good value for the money, in central london”
Reviews.Author: susylonglegs
Reviews.Content: The people who have given this hotel a bad review are setting their expectations too high. This hotel is very centrally located, taking this into consideration the price is very cheap. OK so the rooms could do with a bit of sprucing and they are on the small side but I trawled the internet for a hotel in similar location and price and some were a 100 timeS worse, with horrendous reviews. Perfect location, friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were very warm, in fact I had to turn the radiator off a few time because I was so warm. Would definitely recommend and would stay again without a doubt. Just don't expect the Hilton for a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISSAPOINTING”
Reviews.Author: Anabelines
Reviews.Content: We went on a honeymoon weekend and I booked a Deluxe room what I got was a standard room refurbished. The phone did not work and we did not get any good gesture treatment for it, they did not have upgrades available all weekend and could not even offer us a free breakfast. I am very dissapointed and have programmed another trip to London in March but will not be returning to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: smithsgi
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Berjaya Eden Park last week and were pleasantly surprised. I do not understand the rough patch some travellers have given this hotel. Location wise it could not be more convenient and the staff did everything to make us feel welcome from the moment we arrived. The room was great and had everything we needed, though we did not spend much time there. At certain hour’s everyday the bar offers 2 drinks pay for one, which we loved and we ended up having so much fun with another couple staying at the hotel that we almost missed Mamma Mia, which we had pre-booked tickets for. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a pleasant and welcoming hotel in central London .

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: rplyness
Reviews.Content: The location of the room was perfect but that's where it ends, it looks well from the outside but when we went it it was an awful experience, no less than five people stood staring at us with no one asking to help, eventually when we did get served we were sent to a less than impressive room, when we booked on booking.com we thought we had booked a bright spacious modern room but in fact we were faced with a dark dated cramped excuse for a room, really really disappointing and as it was my fiancee' birthday weekend it made matters worse, to add insult to injury we were ask a fee to leave luggage in the left luggage room, this was the only time in out traveling experience that we have come across this. really really upsetting

Reviews.Title: “Very Unprofessional Management!!”
Reviews.Author: eunice2005
Reviews.Content: I made my booking through www.asiarooms.com on September 2010 for my holiday in UK on December 2010. According to the hotel's policy ~ "there will be no cancellation charge if a booking is cancelled before 10:00 hotel local time 1 day before your date of arrival. If the booking is cancelled later, or in the case of a no-show, the first night will be charged." However, i have cancelled the booking due to a better option. I cancelled my booking on October, which is more than 2 months of notice. I even got my cancellation email from www.asiarooms.com. But to my surprise, on January 2011 when i got my bank statement, the hotel has charged me for 1 night as a penalty. It forced me to made so many calls & write so many emails in order to get my refund. Finally, the hotel has refunded me £94 (one night charge). But due to the currency fluctuation, I have to bear another £5. I sent in the email to complaint, but they never seem want to pay me back which i think it is so unfair to me as i have to bear the cost for their mistake. I try to liaise with www.asiarooms.com too, but they seem to pushing the responsibility around. Honestly, £5 is not really a big figure to me, but as a customer, i am definitely not very happy & satisfied with their service and certainly not impressed with their professionalism. Now that i have to bear all the costs because of their silly mistake. As a tripadvisor member, I think i have the responsibility to write a review here to alert & inform all the members/readers about this issue, i really do not hope anyone of the reader here to have such an unkind experience. Just to be sure to double or even triple confirm your booking cancellation if you do not wish to pay for any cost that caused by someone's mistake. Hope this info helps.

Reviews.Title: “easily accessible”
Reviews.Author: LeithW
Reviews.Content: Again it's near a major transport system, in this case, it's so near to Bayswater Tube station ( Underground) less than 1 min walk behind hotel to the station entrance. Stayed here for 3 nights. Booked through Berjaya vacation club ( i'm member) and STILL HAVE TO PAY FOR IT. Out of all the Berjaya hotels, i would say this is the most worth it stay as the the others are nothing to shout about. It's a boutique hotel with nice lobby. Room given is beter than expected as we were told how small the room by fellow members. Guess they must have given us a bigger unit. Toilet is rather old and small otherwise is quite alright. We were forced to try out the bus service ( due to the tube strike) and some time wasted as it was super peak due to strike.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER”
Reviews.Author: AnneMarie63
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel just a month ago, with my 3 and 6 year old, i thought everything about the hotel was good and was for sure great value for money with very comfy and inviting rooms, the staff was very nice and welcoming, i would definitely recommend this hotel to family's with young children and anyone else to that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good option if on a tight budget but go in w/low expectations”
Reviews.Author: kbscott
Reviews.Content: "You get what you pay for" is the saying that comes to mind here. We booked this hotel for a weekend break because it was so cheap and as most will know, accomodation in London can be very expensive. We got a rate for £186 for three nights where all other hotels were quoting £330+ and I looked a lot!!!! We had a room in the old part of the hotel and yes, it was not fantastic, very small and decor v. outdated but it was clean and you can't fault the location of the hotel (about 2 min walk from Bayswater Tube Station). We had twin beds even though we asked for a double but soon got over it and just drove on. Bayswater is a good location, there are several restaurants, shopping centre, etc at your feet. I understand the rooms that have had a refurb are lovely however, this is not a hotel for a luxury break. I will say if you're on a budget and looking for accomodation which is central and good value than this is it. We booked this hotel with our eyes open and on the basis that it was great value for London and would only be "okay". Our expectations were low and yes, they were satisfied. In short, cheap hotel, great location, clean enough, on a quite residential street and execelllent for sight seeing... anyone looking for something else, look elsewhere :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TimeC2
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel great location good staff, nice room great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Never a 3 star category”
Reviews.Author: RolandFischmann
Reviews.Content: It's a 3 star only for some rooms, never available, even if you want them. The rooms are so tiny, that if one breaths the other one dies... Poor, old fashioned and if you go to the bar, for breakfast or anything make sure to have money in your pocket. They won't charge the room - you'll have to pay rightaway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PBRPBR
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Berjaya for a couple of days, while our flat was being refurbished. It is a very quaint traditional English Hotel, in a fantastic location with excellent public transport facilities. The staff throughout were polite and did their outmost to assist me and my partner. The rooms were very nice and had all of the amenities expected and provided us with a good night sleep. The continental breakfast in the hotel restaurant was extensive, compared to what I have experienced in other hotels and the bar was a great place to meet other people after work. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family and I have already made a booking for my cousin at the Berjaya, for the end of this month.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: Fortalezakaj
Reviews.Content: I was relocated to this hotel due to an overbooking at Kensington Town Hotel. They wanted to place me in a room in the basement with a terrible smell and the carpet was wet! Totally unacceptable - if you have these kind of rooms don't sell them its just a no go and they wanted to charge a 110 GBP for it. The original reservation was made through booking.com and they did nothing to compensate - be careful with online reservations in London especially when big events are going on as the hotels don't care at all they just want to be fully booked at any price - customers loose and are faced with severe problems. There was a Chinese executive with me that had exactly the same experience I had. It shows again that many London hotels are not professionally run.

Reviews.Title: “One night of HORROR!”
Reviews.Author: LoveB
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this place! This place is old & filthy. It was the worst traveling experience in my life! The single room that they gave me, looked nothing like the photos they show to the customers. The room was old and smelly, the carpets were worn out, the bed sheets was old and grey-ish color, the bathroom was dirty and tiny (the sink is in your face when you are sitting on the toilet & you touch the walls when you stand in the shower because it's so unbelievably small), the curtains were very filthy, you could tell that they haven't been washed for a long time, no air-conditioning in the room at all so I had to have the window opened all night. On top of everything, the hotel staff was rude and unhelpful. I couldn't believe it, I actually cried because it was such a horrible experience and I so regret paying the money before I got to see the room. Please do not consider staying at this hotel EVER. It's not even cheap!!!

Reviews.Title: “Okish Budget hotel in Inverness terrace”
Reviews.Author: humphreyappleby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a day since this was one of the cheapest places available. I had heard about the berjaya when i was in malaysia and the rooms there are big. Got a big shock when i realised that my room was the size of a railway sleeper berth. Anyway you get what you pay for. Didnt try the restaurent and only used it for sleeping. nice staff. Dont expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “disgracefull dont bother”
Reviews.Author: PerthKaren
Reviews.Content: stayed ther was in need of accomodation desperately/ foyer was nice and clean, however they demanded the stay was paid inadvance, (PROBABLLY SHOULD HAVE BEEN A LIGHT BULB MOMENT FOR ME). the lift you could barely fit your luggage and two people. The hall ways were dirty old and teh carpet was old mismatched the paint scheme, and had been stretch to hide the holes in the carpet. the room was far to small, the cup and saucers and the headboad the walls and bathroom were all dirty, I got tinea from the bathroom, and there was severe mould the sink in the bathoom, hadn't been fixed to floor correctly and so it could tip over. the lights in the bathroom, didnt work and loo didnt flush. the locks had been taken of the door, so didnt feel safe especially as a single woman traveling on my own. on good point near the tube.

Reviews.Title: “Before you Book....”
Reviews.Author: kathcody
Reviews.Content: .....work out what it is you want in a hotel. If you intend spending a lot of time in the bedroom then this possibly isn't the place for you. Like a lot of London hotels, they make use of every inch of space and therefore bedrooms and bathrooms are small, however, if like us all you want is a clean, reasonably priced hotel that is perfectly placed for a base to explore or go to the theatre then it could be for you? We had no problems with checking in, checking out, sleeping or getting a shower. Any staff we encountered were pleasant enough. We would definitely stay here again if we could get a similar deal.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Lofflunt
Reviews.Content: We landed at Gatwick Airport. Get to the hotel: Gatwick -> Victoria Station - Use the Gatwick Express (every 15 minutes) £16 one way. (It takes 35 minutes.) From Victoria you take the Underground, Circle Line to Bayswater. The hotel is just across the street. (About 20 minutes.) Nice hotel, but were small rooms. About 10 sq.m. main room + 6 sq.m. bathroom. Ok if your not staying too long. We spent 4 nights in this hotel and were quite satisfied. Were good location. (50 meters from Bayswater Underground Station with connections to the District and Circle lines. Circle most used!!) You can also walk down Queensway to Hyde Park and Queensway Und. Station. When you get to Hyde Park (or Bayswater Rd) you can take the bus to the populare shoppingstreet Oxford Street. (TopShop, Primark, New Look, etc.) It only takes a few minutes. You can buy a Day Travelcard for about £ 5,6 pr. day - then you can take the underground in zone 1 and 2 (all you need if your not going to West Ham ...) and public busses. Jump on and off as you please. It's cheeper than the Oystercard. (The same daily price, but you have to pay £ 3 to get the card). Even though the hotel was OK, stay away from the Restaurant. Paid £ 50 for a main meal with almost nothing to drink. Did'nt taste good, and the staff could'nt understand English. There was no fridge at our room which was no good. 24/7 reception. Overall a 6 out of 10, but mostly because of the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “So-so.....”
Reviews.Author: dippy_babe
Reviews.Content: I would say that this hotel was just average. The location of the hotel is great, but the rooms are small, and staff were helpful but not overly friendly. Part of the hotel seems to have undergone renovation and those rooms are lovely, but the rooms that had not yet been renovated was dated in it's decorations. A bit of a pot luck which rooms you get i think! Would i reccomend it? Well......if your'e not going to be in the rooms for long and perhaps not intending to treat a special someone, then this hotel is fine. Otherwise, if you want to make a good impression......i would consider looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HK_Observer
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel enthusiastically to my friends, but I would tell them the cons as well as the pros: Pros: Neighborhood is great. Two tube stations (on two different lines) nearby, many little restaurants and pubs and shops. Close to Paddington Terminal (but not walking distance). Nice pub attached to the hotel. Cons: Rooms are quite small and a bit dated. Plumbing was a bit funky (hard to regulate hot/cold balance). Elevator jammed when we were trying to depart with heavy suitcases. This is a typical London structure -- hotel fit into a series of row houses. The last remodeling of the guest rooms was done a couple of decades ago. As such it has the disadvantages of all such structures -- small rooms, creaky floorboards, funky plumbing. But it is well managed and clean and the price is right. In this category of lodging, it is certainly a winner. P.S. The price asked for Internet access, at 15 quid a day, is outrageous. There is an internet cafe around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mumucienta
Reviews.Content: What I most liked from this hotel was its location: 2 tube stations in 3 blocks, many bus lines, 1 block from a very cool avenue where you can get indian, chinese, britain, italian restaurantes and plenty of souvenir / craft stores!! Service was fine, nothing to complain about. Room is small but let´s face it: it´s London. Everything is small in this gorgeous city! They do not have complementary wifi. We never ate at the restaurante and breakfast was not included. Since there were so many cool places across the street, we did not mind about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good situation but the noisiest hotel ever encountered in my life”
Reviews.Author: GolferSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 4 nights at the Berjaya Eden Park Hotel. The location is brilliant, very close to Queensway and Bayswater Tubes. The first night we were exhausted, so slept pretty well despite not been able to close the window (freezing outside) and the noise from the squeaking floor above and the noisy lift. The next night after being to the theatre, we couldn't close the window so had to get the duty manager to come and slam it shut for us. The noise from the lift was extremely bad, only takes 2 people at a squeeze,so there were many trips to and fro. The next night was the worst and then realised that the lift shaft was right behind our heads, so no wonder the noise was so bad. DO NOT stay in room 311, 308, 309 or 310 for that matter. The floorboards were very creaky and heard every step of the people on the floor above. The bath plug was too small for the plughole, so had to put an exfoliating glove in first, followed by the plug, to prevent all the water from disappearing whilst bathing. The room was very small but clean and adequate for a short stay. I would stay here again if I would be guaranteed not to have a room anywhere near the liftshaft and preferably on the 5th floor so there would be no noise from above.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Overview”
Reviews.Author: StanislavVasiljev
Reviews.Content: Location is good, but transportation with underground from Victoria station is not so fast. Room is not very small, but there is not enough free space for two people. Bathroom is extreme cold and tiny. Stuff are Ok.

Reviews.Title: “good location but not recommended”
Reviews.Author: k_jordan23
Reviews.Content: The location is very good being only 5 min walk from 2 tubes and 10 min into the city centre....... unfortunately thats the only good thing about it, the rooms are very dated and ridiculously small, the bathroom in particular where its a struggle to even fit into the shower, the wash basin isn't big enough to wash your hands and when brushing your teeth you basically have to leave the door open in order to fit in. The whole place feels very closterphobic, with tiny lifts and seriously narrow corridors, even in the middle of november and with the window open fully all day and night the room was still sickeningly hot, as for the hotel services the breakfast was only ok and even though its included in the price of the room hot breakfast's are extra. We stayed for 3 nights but our room was only serviced/cleaned on the last evening only because we had requested it to be done...... twice. Overall i would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: TheWagBand
Reviews.Content: The location was great. We could walk to the tube in less than 2 minutes. There were plenty of small stores, gift shops, restaurants, pubs, and fast food places just around the corner. The price was very affordable too. The rooms were very small though. The hallways were tight and only 2 people could fit in the lift. The lift didn't always work either. I got lost using the stairs. The hotel seems to be a bunch of old row houses put together. It is like a little maze. Our first room had a shower that I could not fit in. It was very uncomfortable. I asked to have my room changed and the new room was much better. Also, the toilets didn't flush that well. I asked the manager if they could have some vegan food available for us in the restaurant for breakfast. He said that he would. The first morning they had nothing but toast. We asked him again later that day and he said they would have soy milk for us the next morning and that the fruit they provided was vegan. The next morning came and they had no soy milk. The fruit looked like it came out of a can. I think the price for the breakfast is not worth it anyway. Go out for breakfast. You'll do better. Also, there is a great panini shop around the corner. Get an iced tea there. It is the only place that seems to have them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money!! Staying again next year!!”
Reviews.Author: allyfuzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the start of the trip and couldnt believe the location, wow its amazing its a short walk to the tube, parks,and internet access. We found the serivce accommodating, and helpful. The hall ways are a little narrow and long, but the rooms are newly renovated( ours was). The room was clean, comfortable, and the bathroom was lovely!. There was a litlle noise outside in the evening, but when u have been travelling for ages you become quite exhusted quickly and dont notice it!. Breakfast was amazing so much food, its a great start to the day!!!We are staying here again next year! we really loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: finney_andrea
Reviews.Content: Hotel was literally feet away from two tubes stop makin getting around the city a breeze. Very easy to get to from Heathrow. Heathrow express goes straight to Paddington station and then its only one stop to bayswater tube stop which is a block from the Hotel. Plenty of shopping and restaurants VERY close by. Rooms were small but to be expected in european hotels. Isn't terribly nice inside but was clean and a perfect place to rest your head and leave your stuff in safety. The staff was very helpful and friendly and even let us use thier front desk computer to check our email about a tour booking. The manager even called the tour company to confirm our booking for us. Also staff was quick to help with any needs including printing maps and directions for us. The people who said the staff were unfriendly must not have been friendly themselves because we felt the staff went above and beyond to help us. Overall, great place for people on a budget and who dont plan on spending tons of time in a room on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “We didn't sleep all night : one of the most noisy and uncomfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ParamountParis
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel expecting a good night sleep in what had appeared to be a nice and comfortable hotel for a reasonable price. Unfortunately, the Berjaya hotel didn't live up to our expectations AT ALL. First, our hotel room for three was located in front of the lift.... imagine the noise of the squeeky doors opening and closing until late at the night. Then, our room overlooked a sort of basement so that the air was extremely stuffy even with the window ajar... Last but not least, our room was right next to the air conditionning machinery : again, very noisy. The worst thing, WE DIDN'T BENEFIT from the air conditionning. In a word, try and sleep at the Berjaya hotel in a hot, stuffy, noisy and quite narrow room for 126 pounds!!! Really not worth it. On top of that, our legitimate complaints were very coldly received by unpeasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out Hotel but great location and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: WelshTulip
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at this hotel. Was thrilled with the location as it was literally minutes from two tube stations making getting around London very easy. Lots of nice restaurants and cafes within steps of the hotel. The hotel itself is nothing to write home about. The outside of the hotel is very pleasant but the rooms do not reflect the same. We stayed with our 4 kids - two teenagers, two younger - with two hotel rooms. They kindly upgraded us free of charge upon arrival and thank goodness they did because the 'suite room' we were given was just a larger size regular room. Our teenage boys rooms was very small and stinking of smoke but we didn't want to move their room as they were located near our room on the same floor. The rooms were tidy but also smelled damp. Bathrooms were clean. DO NOT EAT THE BREAKFAST - total rip off and lousy. go to the small italian cafe attached to the back of the hotel for a great and reasonable breakfast. Overall, I would stay at this hotel for the convenient location and reasonable cost if you are just needing a place to put your head for the night. If you are looking for something special or to spend more time in your room then don't recommend to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: boomslang_sg
Reviews.Content: gd location, near 2 tube lines. room i got was new and nice. got free upgrade to superior room. downside was that it has no a/c and cld get warm at nite during summer.. opening the windows don't help much too..another downside was dat it was noisy at nite coz there is a bar below and i was woken up a few times coz of high revving vehicles. my check-out receptionists weren't friendly too..no "thank-you" or "see you again" from her.

Reviews.Title: “Very small, basement room, with water pipes that drained all night”
Reviews.Author: GrumpyGeorgian
Reviews.Content: I was given a single room in the basement. My window opened onto an alleyway. Although October, it was still rather warm in London, and there was no air conditioning, and I was fearful to leave my window open during the night. One night, the water drain pipes in the wall at the head of my bed ran water most of the night. Not even the ipod could drown out the sound! It took 5 minutes to get from the front door to my room, taking the elevator, then through a maze of very narrow hallways, and up and down stairs in the halls. I will not stay in this hotel again. Staff was friendly, though.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well located - that's all”
Reviews.Author: onewolf
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and in prety good decorative order. It is very well situated within 50 yards of Bayswater Undergorund and 100 yards of Queensway underground. Their rack rates look horrendous but Internet prices seem just about ok for what you get. The staff seemed friendly enough and efficient. The room was tiny with a tiny shower room - no bath. How two people could fit into this double room I have no idea. The room, like, I think, very many of the hotel's rooms, was at basement level (with a rather insecure window into an area) and reached by a labarynthine series of steps, doors and corridors - luckily, on arrival you get a guide. The room was quiet until anyone in an adjoing room talked loudly or flushed the lavatory. The hot water was only luke warm and the radiator was stone cold. I did not try room service or the restaurant - there didn't seem much point with a cosmopolitan array of eateries just 50 yards away on Queensway.

Reviews.Title: “Walls made of paper”
Reviews.Author: Cheb
Reviews.Content: The foyer is deceptive, the rooms are quite buget, run down. Beds are hard, pillows thin and old and the walls are made of paper -could hear everyword of the TV in the next room. Staff were helpful, the problem is with the hotel itself. I would have rated this hotel average instead of poor if I had been able to get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY, not street noise”
Reviews.Author: ronnieireland2
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is fine but we were kept awake all night by the noise of the lift doors SLAMMING open and closed. We were in 308 or 309 which is directly oposite the lift doors. I complaned but was told we colud not be moved, this was on thursday night and hotel not full? staff not very helpful, we ended up getting EARPLUGS from pharmacy! otherwise the hotel is fine for what it is, very well located in cental london so you expect small rooms for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced box basement rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travellerabout
Reviews.Content: We were allocated at the basement with narrow and smelly corridors. The shower rooms as about the size of our bath at home, the only away to use the toilet was to sit side ways. One of the bedroom did not have hot water at the shower. Staff not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Small and loud, but good location”
Reviews.Author: t_w_s_d
Reviews.Content: I didn't directly pay for this room, so I do not know how much it cost. I stayed in two different rooms here and both were very small. One was very awkwardly arranged. There was no room in either room for our luggage. The bathrooms were also tiny, and one of our bathrooms had a leaky ceiling. This hotel was extremely noisy in the early mornings. One maid actually knocked on our door at 7am and asked if she could clean the room. She woke us up. Starting at 6am every morning we could hear the maids in the hallway talking quite loudly. Also, if you get a room near the elevator you ought to ask to be moved. You will not be able to sleep it's so loud. The breakfast was alright, over priced. Internet was over priced as well. Both of these things could be found right around the corner on Queensway for much much cheaper. The location and proximity to Hyde Park and two Tube stations is perfect.
